intro: Cheirolophus benoistii, commonly known as the Benoist's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflowers. Cheirolophus benoistii is often found in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and limestone outcrops.
